intro: Aristeguietia tahonensis, commonly known as the Tahon's arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits, and it plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat.
